scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Give me to drink mandragora.

line_text: Why, madam?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: That I might sleep out this great gap of time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: My Antony is away.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: You think of him too much.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: O, 'tis treason!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Madam, I trust, not so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Thou, eunuch Mardian!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: What's your highness' pleasure?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Not now to hear thee sing; I take no pleasure
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: In aught an eunuch has: 'tis well for thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: That, being unseminar'd, thy freer thoughts

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: May not fly forth of Egypt. Hast thou affections?

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Indeed!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Say thou, shall call her mistress.' So he nodded,

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: That make their looks by his; he was not merry,

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: My salad days,

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Madam, he's well.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

scene_title: SCENE V.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Good madam, keep yourself within yourself:

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

line_text: The fellow has good judgment.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Excellent.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Guess at her years, I prithee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Madam,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: She was a widow,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Widow! Charmian, hark.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: And I do think she's thirty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Bear'st thou her face in mind? is't long or round?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Round even to faultiness.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: For the most part, too, they are foolish that are so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Her hair, what colour?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Brown, madam: and her forehead
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: As low as she would wish it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: There's gold for thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Thou must not take my former sharpness ill:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: I will employ thee back again; I find thee
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Most fit for business: go make thee ready;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Our letters are prepared.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: A proper man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Indeed, he is so: I repent me much
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: That so I harried him. Why, methinks, by him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: This creature's no such thing.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Nothing, madam.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: The man hath seen some majesty, and should know.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Hath he seen majesty? Isis else defend,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: And serving you so long!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: I have one thing more to ask him yet, good Charmian:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: But 'tis no matter; thou shalt bring him to me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Where I will write. All may be well enough.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: I warrant you, madam.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE III.  Alexandria. CLEOPATRA's palace.

line_text: Nay, nay, Octavia, not only that,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: That were excusable, that, and thousands more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Of semblable import,--but he hath waged
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: New wars 'gainst Pompey; made his will, and read it
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: To public ear:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Spoke scantly of me: when perforce he could not
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: But pay me terms of honour, cold and sickly
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: He vented them; most narrow measure lent me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: When the best hint was given him, he not took't,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Or did it from his teeth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: O my good lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Believe not all; or, if you must believe,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Stomach not all. A more unhappy lady,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: If this division chance, ne'er stood between,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Praying for both parts:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: The good gods me presently,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: When I shall pray, 'O bless my lord and husband!'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Undo that prayer, by crying out as loud,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: 'O, bless my brother!' Husband win, win brother,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Prays, and destroys the prayer; no midway
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: 'Twixt these extremes at all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Gentle Octavia,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Let your best love draw to that point, which seeks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Best to preserve it: if I lose mine honour,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: I lose myself: better I were not yours
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Than yours so branchless. But, as you requested,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Yourself shall go between 's: the mean time, lady,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: I'll raise the preparation of a war
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Shall stain your brother: make your soonest haste;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: So your desires are yours.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Thanks to my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: The Jove of power make me most weak, most weak,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Your reconciler! Wars 'twixt you twain would be

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: As if the world should cleave, and that slain men

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: Should solder up the rift.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

line_text: When it appears to you where this begins,

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Athens. A room in MARK ANTONY's house.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

line_text: This is old: what is the success?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Caesar, having made use of him in the wars 'gainst
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

line_text: him partake in the glory of the action: and not

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

line_text: He's walking in the garden--thus; and spurns

line_text: The rush that lies before him; cries, 'Fool Lepidus!'

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE V.  The same. Another room.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: And all the unlawful issue that their lust

line_text: Absolute queen.

line_text: This in the public eye?

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Syria, Cilicia, and Phoenicia: she
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: In the habiliments of the goddess Isis

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: As 'tis reported, so.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Let Rome be thus Inform'd.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Demand the like.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Ay me, most wretched,

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Welcome hither:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Your letters did withhold our breaking forth;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Till we perceived, both how you were wrong led,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: And we in negligent danger. Cheer your heart;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Be you not troubled with the time, which drives
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: O'er your content these strong necessities;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Hold unbewail'd their way. Welcome to Rome;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Of us and those that love you. Best of comfort;

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: And ever welcome to us.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Welcome, lady.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Welcome, dear madam.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Each heart in Rome does love and pity you:

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: In his abominations, turns you off;

scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: That noises it against us.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Most certain. Sister, welcome: pray you,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: Be ever known to patience: my dear'st sister!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VI.  Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

line_text: I will be even with thee, doubt it not.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: And say'st it is not fit.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Well, is it, is it?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: That from Tarentum and Brundusium

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: He could so quickly cut the Ionian sea,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: And take in Toryne? You have heard on't, sweet?

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Celerity is never more admired
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Than by the negligent.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: A good rebuke,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

line_text: Which might have well becomed the best of men,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: To taunt at slackness. Canidius, we
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Will fight with him by sea.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: By sea! what else?

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Why will my lord do so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: For that he dares us to't.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Ay, and to wage this battle at Pharsalia.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Where Caesar fought with Pompey: but these offers,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Which serve not for his vantage, be shakes off;

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: And so should you.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Your ships are not well mann'd;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Your mariners are muleters, reapers, people
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Ingross'd by swift impress; in Caesar's fleet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Are those that often have 'gainst Pompey fought:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Their ships are yare; yours, heavy: no disgrace
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Shall fall you for refusing him at sea,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Being prepared for land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: By sea, by sea.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Most worthy sir, you therein throw away
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: The absolute soldiership you have by land;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Distract your army, which doth most consist
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Of war-mark'd footmen; leave unexecuted
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Your own renowned knowledge; quite forego
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: The way which promises assurance; and
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Give up yourself merely to chance and hazard,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: From firm security.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: I'll fight at sea.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: I have sixty sails, Caesar none better.

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Our overplus of shipping will we burn;

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: And, with the rest full-mann'd, from the head of Actium
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Beat the approaching Caesar. But if we fail,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: We then can do't at land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Thy business?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: The news is true, my lord; he is descried;

scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Caesar has taken Toryne.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Can he be there in person? 'tis impossible;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Strange that power should be. Canidius,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Our nineteen legions thou shalt hold by land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: And our twelve thousand horse. We'll to our ship:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Away, my Thetis!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: How now, worthy soldier?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: O noble emperor, do not fight by sea;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

line_text: Trust not to rotten planks: do you misdoubt
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE VII.  Near Actium. MARK ANTONY's camp.

scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: O, bear me witness, night,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: What man is this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Stand close, and list him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Be witness to me, O thou blessed moon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: When men revolted shall upon record
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Bear hateful memory, poor Enobarbus did
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Before thy face repent!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Enobarbus!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Peace!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Hark further.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: O sovereign mistress of true melancholy,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: The poisonous damp of night disponge upon me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: That life, a very rebel to my will,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: May hang no longer on me: throw my heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Against the flint and hardness of my fault:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Which, being dried with grief, will break to powder,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: And finish all foul thoughts. O Antony,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Nobler than my revolt is infamous,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Forgive me in thine own particular;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: But let the world rank me in register
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: A master-leaver and a fugitive:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: O Antony! O Antony!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Let's speak To him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Let's hear him, for the things he speaks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: May concern Caesar.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Let's do so. But he sleeps.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Swoons rather; for so bad a prayer as his
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Was never yet for sleep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Go we to him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Awake, sir, awake; speak to us.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Hear you, sir?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: The hand of death hath raught him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Hark! the drums
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Demurely wake the sleepers. Let us bear him
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: To the court of guard; he is of note: our hour
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Is fully out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Come on, then;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: He may recover yet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE IX.  OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

line_text: Their preparation is to-day by sea;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: We please them not by land.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: For both, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: I would they'ld fight i' the fire or i' the air;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: We'ld fight there too. But this it is; our foot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: Upon the hills adjoining to the city
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: Shall stay with us: order for sea is given;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: They have put forth the haven
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: Where their appointment we may best discover,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: And look on their endeavour.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE X.  Between the two camps.

line_text: But being charged, we will be still by land,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XI.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Which, as I take't, we shall; for his best force
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XI.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Is forth to man his galleys. To the vales,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XI.  Another part of the same.

line_text: And hold our best advantage.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XI.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Yet they are not join'd: where yond pine
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: does stand,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: I shall discover all: I'll bring thee word
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Straight, how 'tis like to go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Swallows have built
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: In Cleopatra's sails their nests: the augurers
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Say they know not, they cannot tell; look grimly,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: And dare not speak their knowledge. Antony
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Is valiant, and dejected; and, by starts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: His fretted fortunes give him hope, and fear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Of what he has, and has not.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: All is lost;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: This foul Egyptian hath betrayed me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: My fleet hath yielded to the foe; and yonder
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: They cast their caps up and carouse together
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Like friends long lost. Triple-turn'd whore!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: 'tis thou
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Hast sold me to this novice; and my heart
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Makes only wars on thee. Bid them all fly;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: For when I am revenged upon my charm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: I have done all. Bid them all fly; begone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: O sun, thy uprise shall I see no more:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Fortune and Antony part here; even here
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Do we shake hands. All come to this? The hearts
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: That spaniel'd me at heels, to whom I gave
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Their wishes, do discandy, melt their sweets
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: On blossoming Caesar; and this pine is bark'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: That overtopp'd them all. Betray'd I am:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: O this false soul of Egypt! this grave charm,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Whose eye beck'd forth my wars, and call'd them home;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Whose bosom was my crownet, my chief end,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Like a right gipsy, hath, at fast and loose,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Beguiled me to the very heart of loss.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: What, Eros, Eros!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Ah, thou spell! Avaunt!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Why is my lord enraged against his love?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Vanish, or I shall give thee thy deserving,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: And blemish Caesar's triumph. Let him take thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: And hoist thee up to the shouting plebeians:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Follow his chariot, like the greatest spot
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Of all thy sex; most monster-like, be shown
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: For poor'st diminutives, for doits; and let
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Patient Octavia plough thy visage up
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: With her prepared nails.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: 'Tis well thou'rt gone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: If it be well to live; but better 'twere
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Thou fell'st into my fury, for one death
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Might have prevented many. Eros, ho!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: The shirt of Nessus is upon me: teach me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Alcides, thou mine ancestor, thy rage:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Let me lodge Lichas on the horns o' the moon;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: And with those hands, that grasp'd the heaviest club,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Subdue my worthiest self. The witch shall die:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: To the young Roman boy she hath sold me, and I fall
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Under this plot; she dies for't. Eros, ho!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XII.  Another part of the same.

line_text: Help me, my women! O, he is more mad
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Than Telamon for his shield; the boar of Thessaly
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Was never so emboss'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: To the monument!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: There lock yourself, and send him word you are dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: The soul and body rive not more in parting
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Than greatness going off.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: To the monument!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Mardian, go tell him I have slain myself;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Say, that the last I spoke was 'Antony,'
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: And word it, prithee, piteously: hence, Mardian,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: And bring me how he takes my death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: To the monument!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIII.  Alexandria. Cleopatra's palace.

line_text: Eros, thou yet behold'st me?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Ay, noble lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Sometimes we see a cloud that's dragonish;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: A vapour sometime like a bear or lion,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: A tower'd citadel, a pendent rock,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: A forked mountain, or blue promontory
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: With trees upon't, that nod unto the world,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: And mock our eyes with air: thou hast seen
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: these signs;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: They are black vesper's pageants.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Ay, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: That which is now a horse, even with a thought
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: The rack dislimns, and makes it indistinct,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: As water is in water.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: It does, my lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: My good knave Eros, now thy captain is
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Even such a body: here I am Antony:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Yet cannot hold this visible shape, my knave.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: I made these wars for Egypt: and the queen,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Whose heart I thought I had, for she had mine;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Which whilst it was mine had annex'd unto't
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: A million more, now lost,--she, Eros, has
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Pack'd cards with Caesar, and false-play'd my glory
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Unto an enemy's triumph.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Nay, weep not, gentle Eros; there is left us
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Ourselves to end ourselves.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: O! thy vile lady!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: She has robb'd me of my sword.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: No, Antony;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: My mistress loved thee, and her fortunes mingled
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: With thine entirely.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Hence, saucy eunuch; peace!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: She hath betray'd me and shall die the death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

line_text: Death of one person can be paid but once,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE XIV.  The same. Another room.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Did tell me of you, bade me trust you; but
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: That have no use for trusting. If your master

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Would have a queen his beggar, you must tell him,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: That majesty, to keep decorum, must

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: You're fall'n into a princely hand, fear nothing:

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: So, Dolabella,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: It shall content me best: be gentle to her.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Say, I would die.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Most noble empress, you have heard of me?

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: I cannot tell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Assuredly you know me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: No matter, sir, what I have heard or known.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: You laugh when boys or women tell their dreams;

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Is't not your trick?

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: I dream'd there was an Emperor Antony:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: O, such another sleep, that I might see
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: But such another man!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: If it might please ye,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: A sun and moon, which kept their course,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: and lighted
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: The little O, the earth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Most sovereign creature,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: His legs bestrid the ocean: his rear'd arm
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: As all the tuned spheres, and that to friends;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: But when he meant to quail and shake the orb,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: He was as rattling thunder. For his bounty,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Were dolphin-like; they show'd his back above
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: Walk'd crowns and crownets; realms and islands were
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

line_text: As plates dropp'd from his pocket.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra
scene_title: SCENE II.  Alexandria. A room in the monument.
